abstract.p: Laidlaw Inc, operator of Greyhound Lines and North America's largest fleet of school buses, says it should be able to satisfy working capital needs with new credit of up to $200 million that it is close to signing with its banking syndicate (S)

block.p: Laidlaw Inc., the operator of Greyhound Lines and North America's largest fleet of school buses, said it should be able to satisfy working capital needs with a new credit of up to $200 million that it is close to signing with its banking syndicate. Laidlaw, based in Burlington, Ontario, has not paid interest on $3.1 billion of debt since mid-May and has been negotiating an operating loan with 16 banks.
